column5: Dec 17 The following financial services industry appointments were announced on Monday. To inform us of other job changes  email to moves@thomsonreuters.com.

column4: Sun Life sells U.S. annuity business  shares drop
column5: TORONTO Sun Life Financial Inc  will sell its U.S. annuity business for $1.35 billion to a firm connected to Guggenheim Partners in a deal that should reduce the exposure of the insurer's earnings to market swings and boost its cash levels.

column4: UPDATE 3-Sun Life sells U.S. annuity business  shares drop
column5: * Shares fall 3.9 pct on Toronto Stock Exchange   (Adds CEO and analyst comments  updates shares)

column4: CANADA STOCKS-TSX ends lower as Sun Life  First Quantum weigh
column5: TORONTO  Dec 17 Canada's main stock index closed lower on Monday  led by declines in Sun Life Financial Inc  and First Quantum Minerals Ltd after the companies announced major transactions.     The Toronto Stock Exchange's S&P/TSX composite index  ended down 15.37 points  or 0.12 percent  at 12 281.35.

column4: BRIEF-Sun Life to update 2015 financial targets next year
column5: TORONTO  Dec 17 Sun Life Financial Inc :  * CEO says will update investors on 2015 financial targets after U.S. annuity

column4: TEXT - Fitch may cut Sun Life Financial Inc ratings
column5: Dec 17 - Fitch Ratings has placed the 'A-' Insurer Financial Strength (IFS) ratings of Sun Life Financial Inc.'s (TSE  NYSE: SLF) U.S. life insurance subsidiaries on Rating Watch Negative. A complete list of ratings follows at the end of this release.   Today's rating action follows SLF's announcement that it reached a definitive  agreement to sell Sun Life Assurance Company of Canada (U.S.) and Sun Life  Insurance & Annuity Co. of New York to Delaware Life Holdings  a company owned  by sharehol

column4: Sun Life to sell US annuity business for $1.35 bln
column5: Dec 17 Canada's Sun Life Financial Inc  said it will sell its U.S. annuity business and some life insurance businesses for $1.35 billion to Delaware Life Holdings  a company owned by shareholders of institutional asset manager Guggenheim Partners.

column4: Spaniards ditch mobile phones in record numbers
column5: MADRID  Dec 17 Recession-hit Spaniards ditched mobile phone lines in record numbers in October  with the two biggest operators continuing to haemorrhage market share to smaller rivals offering subsidies on handsets.

column4: Telus says Mason avoided disclosing sale of its stake
column5: Canada's Telus Corp  said on Monday it believes U.S. hedge fund Mason Capital Management LLC borrowed or "otherwise acquired" the telecom company's shares at the end of November to avoid disclosing a big reduction in its stake.

column4: Telus says Mason avoided disclosing sale of its stake
column5: Dec 17 Canada's Telus Corp said on Monday it believes U.S. hedge fund Mason Capital Management LLC borrowed or "otherwise acquired" the telecom company's shares at the end of November to avoid disclosing a big reduction in its stake.

column4: Teva to enter Korean drugs market with Handok venture
column5: JERUSALEM Israel's Teva Pharmaceutical Industries  has entered into a joint venture with Handok Pharmaceuticals   aiming to gain a foothold in the $14 billion Korean market.

column4: Teva to enter Korean drugs market with Handok venture
column5: JERUSALEM  Dec 17 Israel's Teva Pharmaceutical Industries has entered into a joint venture with Handok Pharmaceuticals  aiming to gain a foothold in the $14 billion Korean market.

column4: Twitter and Nielsen pair up to publish new "social TV" ratings
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Nielsen Holdings NV  the television viewership measurement company  said on Monday it will partner with Twitter to publish a new set of ratings that measure chatter on Twitter about TV programming.

column4: Russian tycoon becomes Norilsk CEO in board peace deal
column5: MOSCOW Norilsk Nickel  named longtime co-owner Vladimir Potanin as its chief executive on Monday under a Kremlin-inspired deal to end a boardroom war at the world's top nickel and palladium producer.

column4: New U.S. secretary of state shouldn't change Keystone odds
column5: CALGARY  Alberta The prospect of a new U.S. secretary of state should not change the odds of the Canada-to-United States Keystone XL oil pipeline being approved  since previous studies concluded that carbon emissions will not rise as a result of the project  the chief executive of proponent TransCanada Corp  said on Monday.

column4: BRIEF-Weatherford down in premarket after amended 10-k filing
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 17 Weatherford International Ltd  :  * Down 2.4 percent to $10.42 in premarket after amended 10-k filing
